column1: Enable product-option-templates-graphql module to activate GraphQl and Product Option Templates integration. If main plugin was installed manually, please download the GraphQl package under your account and proceed with standard manual installation. If main plugin was installed via composer, then to install the GraphQl package run the following command in the SSH: composer require amasty/product-option-templates-graphql
column2: Enable product-option-templates-graphql module to activate GraphQl and Product Option Templates integration. If main plugin was installed manually, please download the GraphQl package under your account and proceed with standard manual installation. If main plugin was installed via composer, then to install the GraphQl package run the following command in the SSH: composer require amasty/product-option-templates-graphql

column1: Please update Amasty Base module. Re-upload it and replace all the files.
column2: Please update Amasty Base module. Re-upload it and replace all the files.

column1:
There are two ways to create a new options template:
                1. At any product configuration page, please open Customizable Option Templates by Amasty
                expand -> Click 'Add New Template'and define the options -> Save the product.
                2. Go to Template List page and click 'Add New Template' -> Define the options
                and assign at least one product -> Save the template.

                To add an existing template to multiple products:
                - Either at Product Grid, select only products you would like to add this new template to and
                with a new Mass Edit option, 'Add Custom Option Template', choose and apply that new template
                to each product you selected.
                - Or at Template List page choose the required template and open it in edit mode
                -> Click 'Add Products' and select the needed, confirm the action and save the template.

                To delete the existing template:
                - either remove it from all products,
                - or delete it at Catalog > Product Option Templates > Template List.
column2:
There are two ways to create a new options template:
                1. At any product configuration page, please open Customizable Option Templates by Amasty
                expand -> Click 'Add New Template'and define the options -> Save the product.
                2. Go to Template List page and click 'Add New Template' -> Define the options
                and assign at least one product -> Save the template.

                To add an existing template to multiple products:
                - Either at Product Grid, select only products you would like to add this new template to and
                with a new Mass Edit option, 'Add Custom Option Template', choose and apply that new template
                to each product you selected.
                - Or at Template List page choose the required template and open it in edit mode
                -> Click 'Add Products' and select the needed, confirm the action and save the template.

                To delete the existing template:
                - either remove it from all products,
                - or delete it at Catalog > Product Option Templates > Template List.

column1:
One template can have multiple Customizable Options incorporated into it.
Each change made inside this template will be applied to each product into which that template was added.
(instantly upon saving changes in product if there are less than %1 products to update, upon nearest Cron run otherwise).
column2:
One template can have multiple Customizable Options incorporated into it.
Each change made inside this template will be applied to each product into which that template was added.
(instantly upon saving changes in product if there are less than %1 products to update, upon nearest Cron run otherwise).

column1: Please keep in mind that custom option templates containing Percent price option values can be assigned to Configurable products, however, due to Magento's internal limitations, such Percent price option values will become Free upon saving.
column2: Please keep in mind that custom option templates containing Percent price option values can be assigned to Configurable products, however, due to Magento's internal limitations, such Percent price option values will become Free upon saving.

column1:
After saving this product with Amasty Product Option Template(s), please assign it to additional products through Product Grid's mass actions menu as necessary.
'Add Existing Template' allows to add a particular existing template into particular product's configuration.
Once saved, the template can be unassigned from product by using trash can icon.
The template can also be deleted from templates grid at Templates list
column2:
After saving this product with Amasty Product Option Template(s), please assign it to additional products through Product Grid's mass actions menu as necessary.
'Add Existing Template' allows to add a particular existing template into particular product's configuration.
Once saved, the template can be unassigned from product by using trash can icon.
The template can also be deleted from templates grid at Templates list

column1: To make the current option dependent on any other (parent) option’s value(s) please uncheck the ‘Required’ checkbox.</br>Note! There is AND logic between separate dependency lines and OR logic between several option's values within one line.
column2: To make the current option dependent on any other (parent) option’s value(s) please uncheck the ‘Required’ checkbox.</br>Note! There is AND logic between separate dependency lines and OR logic between several option's values within one line.

column1: To avoid loading issues in case of simultaneous assignment of large amount of products to the template we strongly recommend to assign templates via mass action from products list grid.
column2: To avoid loading issues in case of simultaneous assignment of large amount of products to the template we strongly recommend to assign templates via mass action from products list grid.
